concept.title: Overview
concept.shortdesc: The Measurement Library provides key benefits.

ul.li: Streamlined Implementation for Non-JavaScript Tagging: Management Library provides an alternative to hard-coding JavaScript Web beacons on your Web pages, using familiar syntax and tools (for example, track and tracklink).
Integrated Data Tracking: Measurement Library lets you incorporate external data into your data collection (external applications, off-line data, and so forth).

Tagless Implementation: Measurement Library supports server-to-server (Web server to Adobe data collection server) data transfers that can greatly simplify implementation and maintenance of application and website tracking. Server-side measurement also provides a global implementation option independent of the front-end application (mobile application, website, off-line application, and so forth).

Visitor ID Management: Measurement Library provides additional visitor identification options that improve visitor tracking, including limiting third-party cookie usage, using the carrier’s subscriber ID, and using server-side tracking of visitor IDs.

conbody.p:
Before implementing Measurement Library (PHP), you should understand the following concepts and limitations:
Measurement Library (PHP) consists of the following software components. You can download Measurement Library software from Analytics’s Code Manager. For information about using Code Manager, see Code Manager in the Admin Console User Guide, which is available in the Marketing Cloud help system.
OmnitureMeasurement.class.php: A PHP class library. Copy the class library to your Web server where it is accessible to PHP scripts.
To view debugging information related to you website, you can use either the JavaScript debugger or standard Web browser output. Debug information includes request, request headers, response, and errors, when sendFromServer and debugTracking are enabled. See debugTracking.
When using Measurement Library outside of a Web context, any data specific to an HTTP request will not be available (for example, pageURL, userAgent, and so forth).
